alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 01 at 4:01AM CDT until April 05 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting La Crosse and Trempealeau zones. .Heavy rain fell on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Black River Near Galesville. * WHEN...From late Sunday night to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding mainly impacts wildlands and agricultural pasture land. However the approach to the south end of the County Road VV Bridge over the Black River may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1200 PM CDT.
